body.p:
Sheriff's Office,
Lexington, Fayette Co., Ky. Oct 25th 1864.
His Excellency. Thos. E. Bramlett.
Govenor of State of Ky --
Dear Sir --

In accordance with the Statutes & My duty. I arrested and informed on Edw Prior. for Peddling without license, He was fined $100 & costs by our county Judge -- You will be petitioned by his Attys Messrs Hunt & Beck. to remit the fine. as well as the one fourth going to informer.

Our City is overrun with this class of People. who come here. & by Sample Sell from 2 to ^$^10,000 worth of goods in a few days. greatly to the detriment of our business men who have to pay Taxes & Licence for the privilege of doing business -- whilst they go free of Cost or Expence!
I have taken this matter in hand. for the purpose of protecting our resident Merchants. And I hope I may meet with Encouragement from your Excellency --

Yours Respectfully.
W W Dowden S. f. C
